newsitem.title: ITALY: SOCCER-INTER WIN AT NAPOLI TO CUT JUVE'S LEAD TO TWO POINTS.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-INTER WIN AT NAPOLI TO CUT JUVE'S LEAD TO TWO POINTS.

text.p: Frenchman Youri Djorkaeff and Marco Branca were both on target as Inter Milan won 2-1 at Napoli on Sunday to close to within two points of leaders Juventus, held 0-0 at home to Atalanta.
Inter are now second in serie A with 28 points from 16 matches, two adrift of Juventus who enjoyed a six-point advantage at the start of the year.
The European champions, who lost Alen Boksic to injury midway through the first-half, were lucky to escape with a point against Atalanta for whom Gianluigi Lentini hit the post.
Sampdoria will join Inter in second-place if they can beat Cagliari in their match later on Sunday.

Early season pacesetters Vicenza dropped to third on 26 points after losing 1-0 to crisi-hit Milan at the San Siro, the champion's first win in three matches. It took Milan into sixth place on 24 points.
